results.title: Sacred hearts
results.creator_credit: Barbara Rennie, Dee Dee Glass and Reality Productions
results.brief_description: The torment, fear and severe discipline of impressionable schoolgirls at a Catholic orphanage in wartime Britain are brought vividly to the screen in “Sacred hearts”. Sister Thomas, (Anna Massey) is a major contributor to the atmosphere of intellectual, sexual and emotional repression at the convent school, where no signs of affection are tolerated. Excellently acted and constructed, this film exposes some of the myths and rituals which make up our perceptions of convent schools. The cast also includes Katrin Carlidge and Oona Kirsh.

results.title: Night and day
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Arthur Schwartz and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The spectacular musical biography of one of this century’s greatest composers - Cole Porter. Cary Grant portrays Cole Porter and Night and Day shows the popular songwriter’s amazing life story - from studying law at Yale, his bravery in World War I, his romance with Linda Lee to his first Broadway success. Features the evergreen hit songs “Begin the Beguine”, “I Get a Kick Out of You”, “My Heart Belongs to Daddy” and “Let’s fall in love.” Starring Cary Grant and Alexis Smith. Co-starring Monty Woolley, Ginny Simms, Jane Wyman and Mary Martin.

results.title: A Private function
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Mowbray, Mark Shivas and HandMade Films
results.brief_description: Driven by the desperate social ambitions of his wife Joyce, (Maggie Smith), one act of folly turned the life of sensitive, small-town chiropodist, Gilbert Chilvers, (Michael Palin), into a nightmare. With Britain in the grip of post-war rationing, Gilbert steals Betty, a contraband pig being secretly fattened by a group of town dignitaries for a banquet to celebrate the Other Royal Wedding. But there is a price to pay. Gilbert’s squeamishness, his mother-in-law’s senility, and Betty’s incontinence lead to trouble and Gilbert ends up with blood on his hands and the police on the doorstep.

results.title: The Late show
results.creator_credit: Robert Benton, Robert Altman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Ira Wells (Art Carney) is an ageing private eye trying to solve the murder of his ex-partner (Howard Duff), “helped” by Margo (Lily Tomlin), a flaky, aimless young woman. The chemistry between Carney and Tomlin is perfect and echoes of Chandler and Hammett resound in Benton’s complex but likeable script. This quietly authoritative show-stopper is a marvellous comment on classics like “The Maltese Falcon” and “The Big Sleep”, while at the same time taking its place beside them as a superior example of the genre. Also starring Bill Macy and Eugene Roche. Co-starring Joanna Cassidy, John Considine, Ruth Nelson, Howard Duff and John Davey.

results.title: Came a hot friday
results.creator_credit: Ian Mune, Larry Parr, Challenge Film Corporation and Mirage Films
results.brief_description: It is 1949. The privations of war are over and there is money to be made! Two conmen have been successfully cheating bookies at racetracks across the United States. When they stop at a small town called Tainuia Junction, their luck runs out. After waging a war with the local police and the owner of the town casino, they enlist the aid of the Tainuia Kid, a Zorro nut and the wildest comic ever to ride the ranges. It is the bad guys versus the not-so-bad guys in this off-the-wall comedy that takes the viewer on a rollercoaster of laughs against a backdrop of horseracing, gambling, fast cars and loose women. Starring Billy T. James, Peter Bland, Phillip Gordon and Marshall Napier. Based on the novel by Ronald Hugh Morrieson.

results.title: Camelot
results.creator_credit: Joshua Logan, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Adapted from the very successful Broadway show, “Camelot” features songs from the renowned songwriting team of Lerner and Loewe. Starring Richard Harris, Vanessa Redgrave, Franco Nero, David Hemmings and Lionel Jeffries, it tells of the tragic romantic triangle between Arthur, Guinevere and Sir Lancelot.

results.title: Funny lady
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, Ray Stark, Rastar Productions and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Barbra Streisand is the exuberant Fanny Brice, Zeigfield performer extraordinaire in this sequel to the outstanding film “Funny girl”. This lively, lavish musical opens a new chapter in Fanny’s career and love life. Now divorced from the wealthy Nicky (Sharif), she teams up with songwriter Billy Rose (Caan), a brash and unkempt showman who is bursting with enthusiasm and theatrical ambitions. It is a poignant story of their showbusiness magic, unbridled temperaments and passionate romance. Featuring dazzling production numbers, elegant costuming by Bob Mackie and an electric cast, this is an unforgettable.

results.title: King of kings
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Ray, Samuel Bronston and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: In a time of violence and fear came a man of peace, hope, love and forgiveness. The man was Jesus and he changed the world. Panoramic scenes of clamorous battles between Roman legions and Judean rebels contrast with the serene faith of Jesus. From his birth in a Bethlehem manger, Christ’s life is brought to the screen with simplicity and eloquence: his forty day ordeal in the desert, selection of the Apostles, the sermon on the Mount, Judas’s betrayal, the Passion and the Resurrection.

results.title: Europa Europa
results.creator_credit: Agnieszka Holland, Arthur Brauner, Filmkunst and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description: A movie that proves that fact is far more bizarre than fiction. Based on the autobiography of Solomon Perel, “Europa Europa” follows the extraordinary adventures of a Jewish boy becomes one of the prize pupils in the Hitler Youth. Young Solomon’s attempts to evade the Nazi slaughter of the Jews is a tragi-comedy of epic porportions. While the war escalates in horror and intensity, Solomon relies on his good looks and sharp wits to survive. From Communist training camp to the elite Nazi school in Berlin, Solomon’s journey takes him across Germany, Poland and Eastern Europe. “Europa Europa” is such an exhilerating movie to watch - fast, colourful, exciting - it is only on reflection that the full resonance of Solomon’s story has its effect. His chameleon changes of self in order to survive undermine both radical and humanist notions of the “hero” and the film asks unsettling and difficult questions about complicity and collaboration in violence. This film is alive: one moment we are laughing out loud at Solomon’s attempts to hide his penis from view (and its telling lack of foreskin) and in the next moment we confront the stark inhuman obscenity of the Warsaw Ghetto. A rivetting, important, complex film.

results.title: 3:10 to Yuma = Three ten to Yuma
results.creator_credit: Delmer Daves, David Heilwell and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: After a stage coach hold-up and killing, outlaw Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) is captured. Fearing a daring rescue by Wade’s gang who are too strong for the local lawmen to handle, a large bounty is offered to anyone willing to escort Wade by train to the state prison in Yuma. Hard hit by the crippling drought and attracted by the generous sum, rancher Dan Evans (Van Heflin) takes on the job. He collects Wade and begins the dangerous trek to the station.
